page.title: 09 - HOUSING
page.content:
Very little new building has taken place since the war, since the local authority regards the area as agricultural, and much of the area is controlled by two large estates. Around the farms are several farm cottages for the workers.
A common development is to convert old barns and agricultural buildings into dwellings, usually for the better-off.
Local inhabitants are finding it increasingly difficult to find somewhere to live because of the tremendous financial advantage of people who work in London and have access to large sums of money at low interest rates.
Petworth railway station is now a dwelling owned by a journalist.
